intro: Neobakeria marginata, commonly known as the margined Bakeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Neobakeria marginata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
